__e: You see, when I'm winning is the only time I'm not thinking about winning, and I'm never not not thinking about winning because I always win.
It's useless trying to race because you know I always win.
But no matter how hard I try to lose, I always end up winning.
Is this one of those times where I've won the battle but lost the war?
But -- but if I win the bet... You got to get me coffee every morning for the rest of the month.
I'll tell you right after I win my first hand.
If I win, you and your daughter's lives are mine.
I know you don't believe that you're ready, but I do, and I'm your boss, so I win.
Or if your partner is better looking than you, you do, and by the way, I win that one.
I'm a loser at home and a loser at work.
And I try so hard, and... I'm never the one.
I feel like I just won something. I never win anything.
